com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer

Class CircularBufferActor<S,T,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer.CircularBufferActor<S,T,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The producers event type.
    T - The circular buffer target event type.
    R - The java.util.concurrent.Future result type returned when events are produced.

    public final class CircularBufferActor<S,T,R>
extends Object
    Simple actor implementation which uses a CircularBuffer to pass events from many producers to a single consumer.

    This class has a simple lifecycle consisting of 2 states:

    1. Started (see start()
    2. Stopped (see stop(long, TimeUnit))
    The initial state is Stopped. It is illegal to attempt to enter either state unless currently in the other state. It is also illegal to attempt to produce events (see produce(Object, Movable)) unless in the Started state.

    Events are delivered to the supplied CircularBufferProcessor on a the single thread managed by this instance. It is the processor's responsibility to fully process the event, including fulfilling any promises (see Promise.setResult(Object) and Promise.setException(Throwable)) (if applicable) so that upstream threads may be notified on event processing completion.

      static String CONSUMER_TASK_NAME_SUFFIX
      The name of the task submitted by the actor to an executor will be named: ActorName-"Consumer"

    • Constructor Detail

      • CircularBufferActor

        public CircularBufferActor(String name,
                           CircularBuffer<T> buffer,
                           NamedTaskExecutorService executor,
                           CircularBufferProcessor<T> processor)
        Constructor.

        A LockFreeCircularBufferProducer is used.

        Parameters:
        name - The actor name. Used only for logging. Must not be null.
        buffer - The circular buffer. Must not be null and must have a positive capacity.
        executor - The executor on which the consumer is scheduled. Must not be null.
        processor - The processor used to consume the buffered events. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is null or otherwise illegal.

      • CircularBufferActor

        public CircularBufferActor(String name,
                           CircularBuffer<T> buffer,
                           CircularBufferProducer<S,T> producer,
                           NamedTaskExecutorService executor,
                           CircularBufferProcessor<T> processor)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - The actor name. Used for logging and executor task naming. Must not be null.
        buffer - The circular buffer. Must not be null and must have a positive capacity.
        producer - The circular buffer producer.
        executor - The executor on which the consumer is scheduled. Must not be null.
        processor - The processor used to consume the buffered events. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is null or otherwise illegal.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the actor.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the actor is not Stopped.

      • stop

        public void stop(long timeout,
                 TimeUnit timeUnit)
          throws TimeoutException,
                 InterruptedException
        Stop the actor.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout.
        timeUnit - The time unit.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the actor is not Started
        TimeoutException - On timing out awaiting the actor to stop.
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted awaiting the actor to stop.

      • produce

        public Future<R> produce(S source,
                         Movable<S,T,Future<R>> movable)
                  throws InterruptedException
        Produce an event to be consumed by the CircularBufferProcessor.
        Parameters:
        source - The event source.
        movable - The event mover.
        Returns:
        The result of producing the event as returned by the CircularBufferProducer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If called when the actor is not Started.
        InterruptedException - If interrupted while producing the event.
        See Also:
        start()
